body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.82-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2432/folder/13176706/41236862/1084294555 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Win 11/Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Create 2 workspaces setting currency USD - At each workspace, open Company cards page, click Add cards - US -Direct feed - Other - Wells Fargo - select Plaid credit card x3333 and complete add card flow - Navigate on Company cards of the first workspace, assign card for admin 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com 2. Navigate to Company card of the second workspace 3. Click on Assign card and assign card for admin 4. Click back button of "No active cards on this feed" screen 5. Click on Account - Troubleshoot and Clear cache and restart 6. Navigate to the second workspace setting 7. Click on Members tab and invite an employee 8. Click on Company cards tab 9. Click on Assign card and complete flow assign card for employee 10. After assigned card for employee successfully, unassigned card and assign card for admin ## Expected Result: "No active cards on this feed" screen should always display when assign card for admin or employee on the second workspace ## Actual Result: After clear cache and restart, I can assign card feed for employee on the second workspace. If assign card for admin, there's displayed error "This card has already been assigned to this member on a different feed" ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d4d698ed-da10-4933-b8a4-3efdf3913754 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Unable to clear RBR when the composer is not showing

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from this [report](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1764131632533319)

### Problem
When user runs into a situation where a report has RBR error and the composer is not showing for various reasons, we also do not show the RBR option to dismiss the error so they are stuck with the failing report


### Solution

Ensure that if there is a report with RBR, we always show the error and X to dismiss it that will clear this stale report

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @</details>

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @truph01</details>

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.82-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2433/folder/13176791/41237172/1084295773 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2230@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create two manual expenses. 4. Open the just created report. 5. Long tap and select any of the expenses. 6. Tap on the dropdown menu and select "Split" 7. Save splits amount. 8. Once redirected to report again, note that "1 selected" is still visible, despite no expense being selected. 9. Tap on dropdown menu and select "Split" again. 10. Note that you are redirected to a "It´s not here" page. ## Expected Result: Selection mode shouldn´t be still applied after splitting an expense. ## Actual Result: After splitting an expense and returning to report, "1 selected" is still displayed on dropdown menu despite no expense being selected. "Split" option is still visible and leads to "It´s not here" page. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ebae7378-f430-4be0-bc9a-59343f31f2ad [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250]  Security - Full copilot does not have access to change level, but can remove themself

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: BZ Test Jan 26
labels.description: Lauren R running tests on removing BZ from certain parts in issue flows

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.82-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76792 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.6.1 Chrome **App Component:** User Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND as User A and User B in different tabs or devices 2. User A, add User B as a Limited Copilot 3. User B, navigate to Profile and switch the account to User A's 4. User B, open Security page, click 3 dot menu next to copilot 5. Click "Change access level" and "Remove copilot" - "Not so fast" modal appears 6. User A, change copilot access for User B to Full 7. User B - note that the account was automatically switched to the original (copilot mode was exited) 8. User B, enter a copilot mode again and repeat steps 4-5 ## Expected Result: Step 7 - User does not exit copilot mode automatically when the access level was changed Step 8 - Full copilot is able to change their access level or the "Not so fast" modal is the same as for Limited Copilot Step 8 - Full copilot is not able to remove their own copilot ## Actual Result: Step 7 - User exits copilot mode automatically when the access level was changed (Web) Step 8 - Full copilot is not able to change their access level. "Not so fast. As a copilot, you don't have access to this page. Sorry!" RHP is displayed (Web and iOS) Step 8 - Full copilot can remove their own copilot (Web and iOS) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e1e67aa0-9ed4-4b6f-881e-6e0d056508f2 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.name: External

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.82-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/74652 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sjoinsjosjoisdjos@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - App language is Spanish. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense of amount 30.00 4. Open expense report. 5. Click More > Split > Percent. 6. Click on any input field. 7. Enter a comma. BUG 1: Comma cannot be entered. 8. Enter a full stop. 9. Enter any amount after the comma. BUG 2: Number cannot be added after comma. 10. Go to Amount (Importe) tab. 11. Enter 10.00 and 20.00 for the splits. 12. Switch to Percent. 13. Click on any input field and place cursor at the end. 14. Press Delete key. BUG 3: Nothing happens after pressing Delete key. ## Expected Result: BUG 1: Comma can be entered. BUG 2: Number can be added after comma. BUG 3: Delete key will delete the amount. ## Actual Result: BUG 1: Comma cannot be entered. BUG 2: Number cannot be added after comma. BUG 3: Nothing happens after pressing Delete key. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4d78e0ba-17e6-4701-bfbf-6f48564fdc06 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$75] Update ghost text in Expense Threads / Reports

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Slack Thread Context: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C090U774ZH7/p1766084764506399?thread_ts=1766084764.506399&cid=C090U774ZH7 **What the problem is:** The current ghost/placeholder text in report and expense comment boxes is generic: "Write something". The team agreed this does not communicate that Concierge AI can take actions based on the comment, so users may not realize Concierge can create or update expenses. **What the expected output is:** Replace the generic placeholder with copy that clearly signals Concierge can act. The agreed candidate phrases to surface randomly are: Ask Concierge AI to create an expense... Ask Concierge AI to update an expense... Ask Concierge AI to correct an expense... This should only be the placeholder text within expense threads / reports

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @PedroEspinoza1999 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1766076957165449) ## Action Performed: 1. User submits a receipt by sending it via SMS to Expensify. 2. The system processes the receipt and creates the corresponding expense. 3. A Concierge chat is automatically generated for the SMS-submitted receipt. ## Expected Result: Receipts submitted via SMS should be processed silently without generating a Concierge chat, unless there is an error or user action that explicitly requires Concierge involvement. ## Actual Result: Each receipt submitted via SMS triggers the creation of a Concierge chat, resulting in unnecessary messages and noise for users and admins. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The screenshot for the issue is in [OP](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1766076957165449) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Note: users who are someone else's Vacation Delegate should NOT be able to set a delegate of their own (this follows OldDot behavior) Another note: There are probably backend change associated with this (example: Making sure users get live updates when someone sets them as their vacation delegate). Note any of those changes that we may need to implement and we will find someone to implement 👍 ## Screenshots/Videos Plan for NewDot: Similar view from OldDot: [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
